senses.sense_definition: Having multiple folds or pleats, often used to describe physical structures or materials.

examples.text: The <w>polyfold</w> design of the brochure allowed it to contain a vast amount of information in a compact size.
We installed a <w>polyfold</w> door to maximize the usable space in the small hallway.

senses.sense_definition: Possessing multiple parts, aspects, or layers; complex in nature.

examples.text: The reasons for the sudden economic shift are <w>polyfold</w> and cannot be attributed to a single cause.
She presented a <w>polyfold</w> argument that addressed the legal, ethical, and practical implications of the proposal.

senses.sense_definition: Describing spectral terms or energy levels that have the same total and azimuthal quantum numbers but different inner quantum numbers.

examples.text: The physicist analyzed the <w>polyfold</w> spectral terms to better understand the atomic structure.
Transitions of the valence electron occurred between one <w>polyfold</w> level and another.

senses.sense_definition: A metrizable space equipped with an equivalence class of sc-smooth structures, used in symplectic geometry.

examples.text: The concept of a <w>polyfold</w> was introduced to solve transversality problems in symplectic field theory.
Researchers are investigating the properties of the <w>polyfold</w> to apply it to new mathematical models.
